intro: Astragalus ajubensis, commonly known as the Ajuban milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring compound leaves and small, yellowish to brownish flowers. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to thrive in dry, sandy soils. Astragalus ajubensis is often found in steppe and desert environments, contributing to soil stabilization and supporting local biodiversity.
